abstract: The managers of three of the better-performing funds in the fourth quarter found refuge in far-flung places and divergent strategies.
snippet: The managers of three of the better-performing funds in the fourth quarter found refuge in far-flung places and divergent strategies.
lead_paragraph: WHEN the stock market tanks, mutual fund managers prove their mettle. After all, neither investing in Amazon during the tech bubble nor in Exxon Mobil during the oil boom required great resourcefulness or a well-tuned strategy. But it was helpful to have both qualities in the meat-grinder market of 2008 — not to mention a dollop of luck.

headline.main: How Three Mutual Funds Steered Away From the Cliff
headline.print_headline: Three Who Steered Away From the Cliff
